name: integration
content:
integration noun [U]
(MIXING)
Add to word list
Add to word list
C1 the action or process of successfully joining or mixing with a different group of people: racial/cultural integration To promote integration, several schools' catchment areas were merged.
C1 the action or process of combining two or more things in an effective way: He creates a seamless integration of contemporary and historic images. The heads of government were trying to encourage regional integration. Related words
integrate
integrated
More examplesFewer examplesThe president was opposed to racial integration.In a 1956 referendum, the people voted in favour of integration.The signing of the Treaty of Rome was the greatest event in the annals of European integration.Businesses need to be awake to the advantages of European integration.The idea that national identity will be lost as a result of European integration is nonsense.

integration noun [U]
(IN MATHS)
mathematics
  specialized the process of calculating the integral of a function: Integration can be used to find areas, volumes, central points, and many other useful things in addition to finding the area under the graph of a function. Related words
integral
integrateCompare
differentiation
More examplesFewer examplesIntegration is a fundamental operation of calculus, and serves as a tool to solve problems in mathematics and physics.In calculus you will learn about differentiation, integration, circular and hyperbolic functions and differential equations.

the process of combining two or more things into one: integration across sth We need to reduce the differences between local units, with the aim of greater integration across markets.integration between sth and sth How can we achieve a higher level of integration between our company and our supply-chain partners?integration into sth The book examines China's integration into the global economy.integration (of sth) with sth One of the company's weaknesses is poor integration of business processes with information systems.close/smooth/total integration The new database will mean smoother integration with suppliers.
the process of becoming part of a group of people: integration (of sb) into sth The purpose of the induction program is to encourage the integration of new staff into the team.integration with sth The manager assesses other aspects of a new employee's development, such as social integration with colleagues.
